primary_deity.name: Lord Omkareshwar
primary_deity.meaning: The Lord of the Sacred Om, the primordial cosmic vibration

mythology.origin_story: The Shiva Purana narrates that the Devas and Asuras once had a dispute about who worshipped Shiva with greater devotion. Shiva, pleased by both, manifested as two Jyotirlingas on this Om-shaped island—Omkareshwar for the Devas and Amareshwar for the Asuras. The island's natural Om shape is said to have formed when Shiva uttered the primordial sound at creation.
mythology.cosmic_significance: Om is the first sound of creation, the vibration from which the universe emerged. Omkareshwar represents this cosmic principle—the Shivalinga here is the physical manifestation of the divine sound. Worshipping here is said to align the devotee with the fundamental frequency of existence.

sacred_mantras.name: Omkareshwar Dhyana Mantra
sacred_mantras.meaning: Salutations to the Lord of the Sacred Om
sacred_mantras.benefit: Attunes the consciousness to the primordial cosmic vibration, bringing clarity and spiritual alignment

sacred_mantras.name: Pranava Mantra
sacred_mantras.benefit: The foundation of all mantras. Chanting Om at Omkareshwar is said to be especially powerful for meditation and spiritual awakening.
